messages.title: Campaign Focus
messages.content: Local people want someone who will stand up to Labour run Brent Council, fight the bin tax and champion school choice.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tax cuts for workers and pensions to keep benefits.
Employment is at a record high.
Seven-day NHS will be offered to millions.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour's Brexit shambles: Labour's confusion over Brexit backs division not decision.
issues.economy: I'm worried about Labour wrecking the economy locally and nationally.
issues.health: A better future for you, your family and Britain.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm delighted the Conservatives have a real business person standing for Parliament in Brent North. As the MD of an SME I'm worried about Labour wrecking the economy locally and nationally.

contactInformation.address: Printed by Snap Mailing, Unit 4, Refuge House, 9-10 River Place, 90 York Way, London N1C 4QN. Published and Promoted by Luke Parker on behalf of the Brent North Conservative Association, 209 Preston Road, Wembley, London HA9 8NF.

endorsements.endorsement: I'm delighted the Conservatives have a real business person standing for Parliament in Brent North. As the MD of an SME I'm worried about Labour wrecking the economy locally and nationally.
Luke has worked tirelessly to engage with all communities in Brent North; campaigning to rejuvenate the high street, improve local school choice, support families and reward hard work.

images.caption: Campaign slogans and contrasts between Conservatives and Labour

leaflet.additionalNotes: Remembrance: if you haven't sent your postal vote back yet, please take your completed and postal vote pack to any polling station before 10 pm on 7th May.
